RautSoft.math.calculus
Class Differentiation

java.lang.Object
  RautSoft.math.calculus.Differentiation

public class Differentiation
extends java.lang.Object

Calculates the gradient and the Hessian of a function of many variables

Usage:

  FunctionOfManyVariables   myf   = new FunctionOfManyVariables(){
        public double value(double[] x){
            return (x[0]*x[0] + 2*x[1]*x[1] );
        }
    };
        Differentiation ex = new Differentiation();
        double[] x0 ={2, 3};
        FunctionOfManyVariables gradf;
        double d = grad(1, myf,0.000001).value(x0);
        System.out.println("Grad at x = " + d );
        //The overloaded grad returns double
        d = grad(1, myf,x0);
        System.out.println("Grad at x = " + d );
        double h = HessianSingleElement(1,1,myf,.01).value(x0);
        System.out.println("Hessian at x = " + h );
        //the overloaded gradf function returns a double
        h = HessianSingleElement(1,1,myf,x0);
        System.out.println("Hessian at x = " + h );

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lakshmi K. Raut

Method Detail

grad

public static FunctionOfManyVariables grad(int j,
                                           FunctionOfManyVariables f,
                                           double h)
Returns a FunctionOfManyVariables as a partial derivative of the FunctionOfManyVariables f at x with respect xj, j=0, 1, n-1, where n is the dimension of x.

Parameters:
j - partial derivative with respect to xj
f - the FunctionOfManyVariables whose partial derivative to be computed
h - the stepsize
Returns:
a FunctionOfManyVariables say g, then partial of f with respect to xj at a given point z is a double gradValue = g.value(z).

grad

public static double grad(int j,
                          FunctionOfManyVariables f,
                          double[] x)
Overloaded function, returns a FunctionOfManyVariables as a partial derivative of the FunctionOfManyVariables f at x with respect xj, j=0, 1,n-1, where n is the dimension of x, assuming a default value of the stepsize =

Parameters:
j - partial derivative with respect to xj
f - the FunctionOfManyVariables whose partial derivative to be computed
Returns:
a FunctionOfManyVariables say g, then partial of f with respect to xj at a given point z is a double gradValue = g.value(z).

HessianSingleElement

public static FunctionOfManyVariables HessianSingleElement(int i,
                                                           int j,
                                                           FunctionOfManyVariables f,
                                                           double h)
Computes the Hessian of a function of many variables f at x[i] and x[j], i,j=0,1,...k-1.

Parameters:
i - partial with respect to x[i]
j - partial with respect to x[j]
f - a FunctionOfManyVariables object whose hessian is to be calculated.
h - A double value specifying the step. Default is h=.000001
Returns:
Rturns a FunctionOfManyVariables as partial derivative of FunctionOfManyVariables f with respect to x[i] and x[j].

HessianSingleElement

public static double HessianSingleElement(int i,
                                          int j,
                                          FunctionOfManyVariables f,
                                          double[] x,
                                          double h)
Computes the Hessian of a function of many variables f at x[i] and x[j], i,j=0,1,...k-1

Parameters:
h - step size for derivative, a double.
x - 1-D array of doubles denoting the point at which to calculate the Hessian.
i - partial with respect to x[i]
j - partial with respect to x[j]
f - a FunctionOfManyVariables object whose hessian is to be calculated.
Returns:
returns a double as partial derivative of FunctionOfManyVariables f with respect to x[i] and x[j].

HessianSingleElement

public static double HessianSingleElement(int i,
                                          int j,
                                          FunctionOfManyVariables f,
                                          double[] x)
Computes the Hessian of a function of many variables f at x[i] and x[j], i,j=0,1,k-1. Uses defult step size h=0.000001.

Parameters:
x - 1-D array of doubles denoting the point at which to calculate the Hessian.
i - partial with respect to x[i]
j - partial with respect to x[j]
f - a FunctionOfManyVariables object whose hessian is to be calculated.
Returns:
returns a double as partial derivative of FunctionOfManyVariables f with respect to x[i] and x[j].

diffRiddersMethod

public static double diffRiddersMethod(FunctionOfOneVariable func,
                                       double x,
                                       double h,
                                       nrutil.pDouble err)
Returns the derivative of a function func at a point x by Ridders’ method of polynomial extrapolation. The value h is input as an estimated initial stepsize; it need not be small, but rather should be an increment in x over which func changes substantially. An estimate of the error in the derivative is returned as err.

Parameters:
func - Function to be specified as the Interfaces.FunctionOfOneVariable
x - at which the derivative is estimated
h - Initial step size
err - a pDouble object, and pDouble.value will contain the error estimate
Returns:
a double value
